required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oxytocin Versus Cord Blood for Improving Autistic Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Oxytocin and Umbilical Cord Blood for Improving Autistic Spectrum Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The clinical study evaluates in an open-label, crossover design the comparative efficacy and safety of intranasal oxytocin and autologous umbilical cord blood for improving the functioning of children with autistic spectrum disorder

detailed_description.textblock: Children aged 3-7 years diagnosed with autistic spectrum disorder and who did not previously receive oxytocin or umbilical cord blood treatments, will be enrolled to receive both treatments in random order. Assessment of functioning impairment will be done with QCHAT/M-CHAT/CAST questionnaires initially, at 2 months, 6 months and 1 year after first treatments. Either oxytocin or cord blood will be administered initially and at visit 2, which will take place at 2 months. All children will receive both treatments. A total of 25-40 children are expected to enroll and complete the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in behaviour, interaction with family and peers
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 2 months after administration of either treatment
primary_outcome.description: change in scores on M-CHAT (Modified Checklist for Autism in Toddlers) questionnaire; total score, maximum 20, lower is better

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in behavior and social interaction
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 2 months after administration of either treatment
primary_outcome.description: change in score on Q-CHAT (Quantitative Checklist for Autism in Toddlers) questionnaire; total score, maximum 100, lower is better

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in overall functioning of the child
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 2 months after administration of either treatment
primary_outcome.description: change in score on CAST (The Childhood Autistic Spectrum Test) questionnaire; Total score, maximum 39, lower is better

arm_group.description: Intravenous administration of autologous umbilical cord blood

intervention.description: daily administration of oxytocin, 10 UI intrnasal, 5 UI bid, and if needed curcumin orally 250 mg bid, and/or lecithin 500 mg bid, and/or pironoquinolinquinone, 20 mg qd
patients aged between 3 and 7 years will receive one-time intravenously the processed umbilical cord blood collected at the respective child's birth

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosis of autistic spectrum disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- metabolic or genetic disorder (ex storage disease, Down, etc),

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Informed Consent Form
